name: Cuprum aceticum
Relationship: Acts similarly to CUPRUM MET. but is more violent in action.

Head: Violent throbbing and lancinating pains in forehead
Left-sided brow ague
Brain seems void
Inclined to gape and cry
Loses consciousness; HEAD REELS WHEN IN HIGH-CEILING ROOM
Constant protrusion and retraction of tongue
Neuralgia with heaviness of head, burning, stinging and stitching in temples and forehead
Respiratory: Attacks of angina pectoris coming on when excited
Stomach: Violent spasmodic pains in stomach and abdomen
Face: Facial neuralgia in cheek-bone, upper jaw, and behind right ear
Better by chewing, pressure, and external warmth
Skin: Leprous-like eruption, without itching, over whole body, in spots of various sizes

details: Hay-fever, with burning excoriation, paroxysmal cough; tough, tenacious mucus, and fear of suffocation. PROTRACTED LABOR. Chronic psoriasis and lepra.
